website_summaries.verdict: Excellent value. Two knives for one price. Great options for hunters in the field.
pros: Set includes a gut hook knife and a straight-edge skinning knife
Dual carry sheath for both knives
Camo-colored green handles have non-slip texture
Extremely good price for two knives
cons: Knives may cut through the sheath when in storage

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the reviews the knives come razor sharp. Hahaha don't listen to those. I had to take them and get them professionally done. But once sharpened they sliced through my deer with no problems. Good knifes but you may have to sharpen them.
customer_reviews.author: Texas 1980

customer_reviews.title: Excellent knives.
customer_reviews.text: I won't subject you to the gory details, but these knives perform exactly as they should and the handles do not get slippery when wet. They seem sturdy and well built and I expect to get many more years of use out of them. My only complaint would be that it is not easy to snap them secure once they are back in the sheath, however its not enough of a problem for me to downgrade from 5 stars. The sheath itself holds them securely enough that I don't bother snapping them in anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I thought it would be, but that's okay
customer_reviews.text: These things are smaller than I'm used to. But you know what? Most knives I use are too big when I'm getting under the skin and working around the neck and back straps. I commonly hang a hog and just remove the back straps and hind quarters so I skin and peel back the hide just where I'm working and I feel these are just right. They have a nice sheath that they come with that keeps them together and since they're smallish, I could carry them on my belt if needed. And these came SUPER sharp so perhaps the reviews I saw about them not being sharp was a fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B.

customer_reviews.title: Sheath is cheap knife now lost!
customer_reviews.text: I urchased the knife just over 1 year ago just for my hunting pack. I used it one time for a harvest but had it too sharp it cut the sheath that stores it open and the blade is now in a field somewhere. I notified the customer support looking for a replacement sheath and small skinning blade and after days a repeating the same pictures and emails (run around) they don’t cover it, so when your sheath falls apart etc. too bad. My fault you get what you pay for ha ha.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel

customer_reviews.title: Great sharp knives!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic knives! I actually used the smaller one to skin a deer and it performed flawlessly. Now using it to break the deer down and still haven't had to resharpen. Buying a second set soon to keep in field bag. UPDATE: Used the set to field dress a doe, then skin and process. Still not resharpened. The gut hook knife is great, the finger hole and ridges really help you keep control of the blade, especially while wearing field dressing gloves. Highly recommended. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa H. Dulinski

customer_reviews.title: Sticks in Case
customer_reviews.text: I thought these knives would be better than what they are. I order another pair of knives a while back which are not sold on here anymore. I wanted the same knives but this was the closest thing to the one I had before. They do not keep an edge and the pouch they came in, the gutter sticks in the case and is hard to get out. I would not by this set again. I will look for a different set of hunting knives for myself and my husband.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Great knives for small to medium size game
customer_reviews.text: They came with a decent edge on then. But I sharpened them even more. Skinned a squirrel shortly after. Worked great. These are more for small to medium sized animals. Probably not my first choice to skin a deer. But could be helpful in skinning a large animal. But not the majority of the skinning. Great knives though.
customer_reviews.author: Larry W.

customer_reviews.title: A must buy, for any Hunter, amateur or veteran!
customer_reviews.text: Great knives, they could be sold for more, and at this quality, I'd have paid double. I seen that a couple people had to take theirs in to get them sharpened so I did the day I got them. The guy just kind of looks at me and says "I think you just drove all the way here for no reason son" so damn you people for saying it was necessary. Just kidding, but seriously, the only complaint I have is that the sheath doesn't hold the 7 inch blade in all that well. But I bought the knives to use, I can get a sheath for cheap anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Richard and Julie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, sharp
customer_reviews.text: Great quality knives for the price. Came to us super sharp. My husband really likes that both knives fit into the same sheath. Makes it incredibly easy to take up into the woods. Haven't got a chance to put them to the test in the field but we are eager to try them out this hunting season. We have had some trouble with skinning knives that have loose handles and have a bit of a give but that hasn't been an issue here at all. Very solid and would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Deseray Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the expense
customer_reviews.text: They're not high-dollar, but I'll use them the upcoming Deer & Elk hunting seasons. Both knives appear to be somewhat substantial and I like the nylon sheath they're carried-in; time will tell. 9/12/20: Both the knives I received were definitely in need of sharpening. With that done, I'm confident they'll work as expected this fall; hope so anyway!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really cool set of knives, sheath not so much.
customer_reviews.text: Nice set of knives. They came razor sharp out of the box. They do have a nice weight for being small. They fit well in the hand. The only not so great thing is the sheath. The idea is good keeping them in the same sheath but, the strap for the skinning knife sits in front/on top of the gut hook. And trying to get the gut hook out is a bit awkward. You're better off making a custom sheath that holds both or if it doesn't bother you just go with it. The knives are still worth the price. Great set!
customer_reviews.author: Jonny84

customer_reviews.title: Good size and balance
customer_reviews.text: Size it's not a problem for me (I'm 5' 9" height). Very sharp just out of box. I need to tested in field.
customer_reviews.author: Elinge

customer_reviews.title: Great knives for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Really great knife set for the money. Between getting two knives and the nice scabbard this is a great value. I don't think the knives are super sharp, but they are sharp enough. As a bonus they look great, really nice.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Updated
customer_reviews.text: These did not come sharp enough to use but I was able to get them pretty sharp. They seem pretty strong. After using them, and needing to sharpen them basically everytime I use them I cannot recommend them. You can get them sharp but they do not hold an edge. They will be going dull before you even have your deer dressed. The day I shot 2 deer I was basically sawing through the 2nd one. I am looking at knives right now and saw the listing for these and decided to change my review.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: The set of knives are very nice. They feel comfortable and fairly durable. My knives came in fairly sharp, so sharp that it stabbed through the sheath... which is fairly cheaply made. It feels nice and is made with a durable material but the edges are a very cheap material. The knives just stab right through it it your bat careful putting them in the sheath. The gut hook also gets caught on the sheath when pulling it out. The buttons are very hard to close. Other than the sheath issue, the knives are very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mason W.

customer_reviews.title: Hunters Review
customer_reviews.text: Bought these knifes for my birthday need some knifes for hunting and saw these. They are very well made and designed. Blades come in a belt loop pouch for your carry and ease of access. Blades are very sharp right out of the package no need to sharpen. Handles I belive are a harden ABS Plastic witch is a very durable plastic but they don't seem to have a grip to them so if wet be careful they don't slip. Have not tested wet yet but will update when the opportunity presents itself other than that overall good knifes for hunter to carry on them at all times for anything hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: I’ll think of this company.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product believing that it was made in the USA. Elk Ridge states that they are the biggest knife manufacture in the United States. Seems like they don’t mind misrepresenting themselves. Knives are made in China. Next time or US soldier catches an AK-47 bullet I’ll think of this company.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth P. Green

customer_reviews.title: Great knives, get one
customer_reviews.text: I just unboxed them. They are both nice and heavy with a great grip, non-slipping. They feel great and both are razor sharp, be careful taking them out of the sheath. I think they would be perfect for hunting and field dressing knives. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: nucrph

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for meat processing
customer_reviews.text: Husband processes his own game, from field to freezer. He does not like these knives. Maybe they're okay for just skinning? But "not what you use to cut up a deer." Rather than paying to ship it back and driving all the way back into town to return it, I guess we'll give it to someone. Another failed attempt at gift giving, Happy Father's Day.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and holds an edge
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about it at first because of the price but this set works amazingly. Without sharpening, it processed an entire deer and then was still sharp enough to split my finger (accidentally) just by putting a small amount of pressure on it. The next day I bought another set for my dad.
customer_reviews.author: Tucker E.

customer_reviews.title: Great hunting knife set!
customer_reviews.text: Wow are these hunting knives amazing! Cut through almost anything like butter. My preferred knife set and they seem to never dull! The only problem I have come accross is the fact that they are on the smaller side and my husband who has larger hands can not get his finger through the hold. He says if they were larger they would be the only ones he uses.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sheath problems
customer_reviews.text: Hi So far the knife seems like a good purchase but before I could even try it I noticed that the bottom of the sheath was open. The knife pokes through and due to it's sharpness I knew it was going to get worse so I put in for an exchange. The interesting thing about the stitching is that there is two lines of separate stitching and I don't see how that would stop the gut knife from cutting through. Perhaps with a tighter stitching and perhaps something at the bottom of the pocket that would prevent it from pushing through would fix the issue. I will see if the replacement has the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Romi

customer_reviews.title: Solid set of knives
customer_reviews.text: I used these to skin and field dress deer. Sharpen once you receive them and they hold an amazing edge. The metal is quality and very solid built. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: I love these knives
customer_reviews.text: Wife got me these as a birthday present. I love these knives, they came extremely sharp and haven't needed sharpened even after 2 deer and 2 turkeys. Still as sharp as the day I got them. You won't regret buying these knives.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Love elk ridge!
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten quite a few elk ridge knives because they are extremely high quality for the price! These were no exeption! Great product! I had to slight sharpen the right out of the box but not really a big deal! Only took about 30 seconds!
customer_reviews.author: Red Chameleon

customer_reviews.title: IMPRESSIVE, the knives are REALLY sharp and dangerous; ...
customer_reviews.text: IMPRESSIVE, the knives are REALLY sharp and dangerous; i cut myself in 2 mins and someone else did even after i warned them. The knives are tiny but you skin a deer or a hog in just a few mins and they're so sharp they cut through everything. Very impressed; too sharp to carry on a holster next to ur body, keep em away from ur body while driving or anything to avoid accidental anything.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: nice set
customer_reviews.text: nice set have not used yet, was not sharp out of the box, convenient sheath to keep up with them
customer_reviews.author: matthew williams

customer_reviews.title: Affordable skinning knife
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy knives used to clean a deer this year and worked well. The finger hole is a little sharp but not used very long.
customer_reviews.author: meagan ormand

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay sharp
customer_reviews.text: Shape, size, everything or perfect EXCEPT they won't stay sharp. Had to sharpen 3 times just skinning a small buck, and eventually gave up and switched to an inexpensive Farberware paring knife to finish off. They're cheap, so I didn't expect much and it's not like I can complain
customer_reviews.author: Veronika

customer_reviews.title: Nice set up.
customer_reviews.text: I got these knives today and I give them 5 stars. This is a great value for the money. It comes with a decent sheath, so both knives fit comfortably side by side. I had to hone both knives on my ceramic rod, and they were good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Weldon Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great for small game
customer_reviews.text: Did a rabbit skinning/gutting demo with these knives - they are nice and sharp right out of the package. Did a great job and allowed for some really nice precise work. Great if you have thin-skinned animals like rabbits and squirrels and you dont want to damage the furs.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Didnt come sharp, but i loved them, fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I skin,gut,and process deer, sharp is important I didnt get a them sharp, but no big deal to me I re sharpen after every animal, the small knife is amazing, the gut hook wasn't sharp so I used a old one, but the big knife worked fabulously, the handles are awesome wet slimy hands and I can still grip them without cutting myself
customer_reviews.author: kayla

customer_reviews.title: Cheap gift for sisters boyfriend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift and he seems happy with this. Still cant kill anything because he's a terrible shot but if he ever hits a deer with his truck it should still be sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Raeannah Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Well made! Durable!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for working on some animal hides. Knifes are shard, durable and fit my hand well. The belt sheath is heavy duty and well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Heather L. Sison

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: The knifes are great but I had a problem with the sheath the front pocket had been ripped off and I did not have it for a week
customer_reviews.author: Janet L Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Good backup knife
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t use this as my go-to hunting knife, as it doesn’t hold an edge very long. However, it looks really neat and is a good knife to carry in the pickup in case we forget a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: I culled chickens over the weekend and used this to do the gutting and it was very easy to work in such a small area with these
customer_reviews.text: Fairly impressed. Cheap, sharp as can be? I culled chickens over the weekend and used this to do the gutting and it was very easy to work in such a small area with these knives. The holder is also nice since it's a two in one keeping the clutter down on your belt. Proof you don't need to spend $100+ to get a good knife.
customer_reviews.author: ICeMAnAbk

customer_reviews.title: Dull
customer_reviews.text: I returned these as they're not sharp at all. Cumbersome to get in and out of sheath
customer_reviews.author: djawboogie

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME DEER KNIFE!
customer_reviews.text: Took down a blacktail deer this weekend and the knives worked great! We didn't have to sharpen either knife. I have bought expensive knives in the past and have to say this has been my favorite. It is a great set to throw in the pack when you take down an animal deep in the woods. Possibly going to buy another one as a gift !
customer_reviews.author: James T. Beard

customer_reviews.title: These are too small to be used as intended.
customer_reviews.text: These knives are small... I mean really small. I have an average size hand and when I tried to grip the knife I could only get 2 - 2 1/2 fingers on it. NO way to get a good grip. Returned immediately. They won't do the job.
customer_reviews.author: MWill

customer_reviews.title: Knife
customer_reviews.text: This two piece set is a great price and great quality. So glad I purchased this one. There's tons to choose from but i'm glad I got this one over the competitors. I take it hunting with me every time, it has come in handy this season.
customer_reviews.author: Neal

customer_reviews.title: Made 2 hunters happy!
customer_reviews.text: My brother-in-law liked them so much last year that I bought them again this year for my brother.
customer_reviews.author: Alison A.

customer_reviews.title: made well
customer_reviews.text: made well I just wish it was a little sharper but good value for the price
customer_reviews.author: Collins Family

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be very well made sturdy holds a nice edge and fairly inexpensive
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome deal. Nice size and durable. My favorite hunting knives. Comes with a sheath that keeps the pair together.
customer_reviews.author: BayouMom

customer_reviews.title: Nice knives
customer_reviews.text: They are light and easy to pack. a good back up set. A good sheath very compact easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Norman

customer_reviews.title: Better quality then expected for the cost!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to hopefully reduce time butchering my guinea hogs. Boy did it ever! It holds a sharp edge without needing to be resharpened and made skinning and butchering an easy job. These feel like solid well built knives and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HarlequinMuse

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Great price!
customer_reviews.text: Used then on several deer without sharpening with minimal to no tearing. Felt like a surgical setup. When I did use ceramic to touch it up, it took back that razors edge again. Really good knives so far
customer_reviews.author: Justin Denmark

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp and very easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: Great knife set and at a great price. Very sharp and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Misty Tencza

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was my first knife I got for harvesting an animal and it was very easy to learn with. Its easy to handle and great product for the price. The gut hook works great and makes skinning much quicker.
customer_reviews.author: Dolmanet

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Won't hold an edge. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: michael l.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have had this a couple years now. I do A LOT of hunting and this has not let me down yet. Absolutely great product. Don’t forget to wash the he sheath
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife set.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game knife set. short, sturdy. looks good. The set is great. If you want ONE game/fish knife, then i would go with a Mortakiv. (link below). Either way, this is a necessary for your kit. MORAKIV -
customer_reviews.author: John P. Salvaggio

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Knife set arrived very sharp. Love the way these knifes feel in my hand! Loved it so much bought a set for a friend for the up coming hunting season.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M.

customer_reviews.title: Came dull but look nice
customer_reviews.text: Both knives came dull. Couldn’t even slice paper. Having second thoughts if these knives will even hold an edge.
customer_reviews.author: J05hh

customer_reviews.title: good knives
customer_reviews.text: have cleaned several deer with this set. Knives can be easily resharpened thanks to quality steel
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They look as expected and are easy to use
customer_reviews.text: They look as expected and are easy to use, but they do not hold an edge very well. We used them when butchering chickens and had to resharpen frequently during each bird. Ended up going and getting a kitchen knife.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Clean cuts
customer_reviews.text: Enables me to get a good clean cut of meat. Without struggling with a dull knife
customer_reviews.author: Brenda F.

customer_reviews.title: A Gift Well Received
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Great quality. Fast shipping. Happy customer. Received in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy J. Avery

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality sound tools for use in hunting or skinning ...
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality sound tools for use in hunting or skinning work. Just the right size to put in my back it does not take up to much room and is light.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela L. Doane

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great product clean 3 deer with it and still sharp.
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Add didn’t say it was made in China. I would have never bought it. Product is cheap so I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Cool set for the money
customer_reviews.text: Cool set for the money. I like that they come with a double sheath allowing them both to be housed in one. Not the best steel but that's to be expect with cheap little knives like these.
customer_reviews.author: John of all trades

customer_reviews.title: Sharp AF
customer_reviews.text: I love it.. it looks really good and very sharp I will say it’s smaller then what I thought it was gonna be but i still like it I can’t wait to test it on a deer
customer_reviews.author: D.Byrd

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING SET
customer_reviews.text: We got these to have when we go hunting, however we've not been hunting yet. We have been butchering rabbits this past week and these knives are amazing! They get the job done quick and easy. The design is flawless and they are sharp. VERY PLEASED!
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: Very strudy knife. Great for skinning. Fits perfectly in hands. Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew E.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t put it to use yet, but the quality appears to be pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy blades for the price. For a more in depth review please go to the YouTube channel called No Filter Reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Pettit

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: These were cheaper than the ones we kept but our friend was very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Bridgenag

customer_reviews.title: Great Set
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little set of Hunting Knives. Can't wait to put them to good use.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: These are great. They feel right in my hand
customer_reviews.text: These are great. They feel right in my hand. The balance and grip are pretty solid. These make great additions to the tool kit.
customer_reviews.author: TenK

customer_reviews.title: good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: had issues with the case but that was replaced with a quick and easy process so far no issues since then. came fairly sharp also
customer_reviews.author: russell cole

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp, but a great deal
customer_reviews.text: These do not come very sharp. I spent some time putting a 20 degree angle on them. Now they are where they need to be. Used them to prep a rack of ribs. Couple of nicks in the handle showed up white. Easy to cleanup with a black marker. Satisfied with them for the price
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great set!
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great knife set for under $20. Construction seems like a 7-8/10 and seems to keep a blade. We'll see when I get my elk this year! I live the combo pack and that it comes with a sheath.
customer_reviews.author: Strider

customer_reviews.title: well made the size as it turn out works perfect
customer_reviews.text: This set is surprisingly well made the size as it turn out works perfect for small game up to deer. They will feel lie an extension of your finger, the gut hook works for most, a big hog will about the max thickness of hide. They come sharp,
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Quality Knife.
customer_reviews.text: Just used this morning on the 4th deer and this knife is small but mighty. Very good on bone and the gut hook works very well. Well worth more than the price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Came Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used yet but have used other Elk Ridge knives. These came sharp enough to shave arm hairs right out of the box. Gonna have to kill another deer to give them a try. So far very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Jarod Voss

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: We bought these and returned them. They seemed to be smaller than we expected. The Knives seemed to be well made, just small. No fault to the seller or description.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Elam

customer_reviews.title: but in reality they are really good quality and look really nice in person
customer_reviews.text: The amazon photo makes them look cheap and plastic-y, but in reality they are really good quality and look really nice in person. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Frank the Tank

customer_reviews.title: Durable blades for the price and easy to resharpen
customer_reviews.text: Stays sharp. Works well. Durable blades for the price and easy to resharpen. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: John johnson

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again. Nice gift idea
customer_reviews.text: Got it last Christmas. Just used it to gut, skin and butcher a 7 point. Worked perfectly. I like that it is small and light. I did sharpen it on a diamondstone in between jobs. Nice buy for under 20 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: SLM

customer_reviews.title: perfect for small game....
customer_reviews.text: I use these knives to cut the kill.... nice skinning and gutting knives. Could be a little bigger. But I love them ... just keep them sharpe and they do the job
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great knife set for a great price. Very sharp with a decent quality build.
customer_reviews.author: Jewell

customer_reviews.title: not sharp enough
customer_reviews.text: not sharp enough, needs to be professionally sharpened. as is would not cut coon skin
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a an Xmas present. Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.author: Yo!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, as described, gave as a gift they loved it
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Pritt

customer_reviews.title: Ok nothing great knifes are small
customer_reviews.text: They are alright worst part the knifes they are too small.
customer_reviews.author: Duke Royce

customer_reviews.title: Decent Knives, Flimsy Sheath
customer_reviews.text: Knives seem good but the first time I put the smaller knife back into the sheath it pierced right through and cut my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A few passes on my new Lansky sharpener and they will cut skin like its hot butter
customer_reviews.text: got them and they were not as sharp as I had hoped. A few passes on my new Lansky sharpener and they will cut skin like its hot butter.
customer_reviews.author: prefer not to say

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Nice knives for the price. Handle finish wasn't perfect but doesn't make a difference with its effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: curtis

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty nice knife. Easy to carry and very sharp. The price is good and I take them very time when I go for hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Yang

customer_reviews.title: awesome set for the money
customer_reviews.text: You can not beat the price perfect for in the field ..If you lose it not a big deal buy another set sometimes i lose them on the ground after gutting deer decided to put orange tape on the handle this year ..
customer_reviews.author: David Santos

customer_reviews.title: Great for the hunter and outdoorsman alike
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set. Very durable case and well built. Both knives come very sharp and feel gret in the hand. They make an excellent hunting or skinning pair.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hurd

customer_reviews.title: Great Knives Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I had my reserves about this set but I am so glad I pulled the trigger. Everything for hunting seems to cost an arm and a leg so it was nice to get a quality item at a reasonable price. I purchased these 5 years ago and still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Jones

customer_reviews.title: Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Knives are sharp so sharp that they cut the stitching to the sheAth better thought could of went into desighn of sheath
customer_reviews.author: RobArwine

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I finally used the knife set on a doe this year. The knife was very sharp and preformed perfectly it is a great buy for the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Jake A

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: This set isn't the most expensive but don't get caught by the price. I've used it to great length this past summer butchering a home raised cow. It held up amazingly well thought the skinning and cutting process. Outstanding value!
customer_reviews.author: Taz969

customer_reviews.title: Great knife set!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this almost three years ago. Broken down 2 deers and 1 turkey! Great set!!!
customer_reviews.author: joeU

customer_reviews.title: Great knives
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my brother and he loved them! Their quality was better than I expected and I foresee these knives getting plenty of use in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Scott

customer_reviews.title: I bought Szco knives earlier and I have to say that Elk Ridge is MUCH better..
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with Elk Ridge Knives, I bought Szco knives earlier and I have to say that Elk Ridge is MUCH better...even their sheaths are great. Perfect knife for Bushcrafting/Camping/Hunting...plus the handles have an awesome grip...Great knives for those on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Serpentino

product_meta.title: Elk Ridge - Outdoors 2-PC Fixed Blade Hunting Knife Set - Black Stainless Steel Skinner and Gut Hook Blades, Camo Coated Nylon Fiber Handles, Nylon Sheath - Hunting, Camping, Survival - ER-300CA
product_meta.description: The Elk Ridge Hunting Knife Two-Piece Set (model ER-300CA) features straight edge and gut hook blades plus camo ABS handles, with 7-inch and 6-1/2-inch overall lengths. Ideal for anyone who spends time in the wilderness or likes to hunt, this set's trailing point hunting/skinning knife features a 3-1/2-inch, 440 black stainless steel blade. This full tang knife has a green camo ABS handle with finger grooves and a lanyard hole which will allow you to easily affix extra cordage. It's complemented by a deep bellied knife with a gut hook on the top edge, which features a 3-7/8-inch, 440 black stainless steel blade with a finger hole for tighter control. This full tang knife has a green camo ABS handle with a non-slip texture and thumb jimping on the back of the blade for added control. Both knives are easily stored in the black nylon dual carry sheath for easy and safe carry. Grade 440 stainless steel contains more carbon, giving it excellent hardness and edge retention. Designed for true outdoors adventurers, Elk Ridge offers a wide variety of hunting knives, skinners, game sets, machetes, axes, and even gentleman's knives.
feature_bullets: HIGH QUALITY MATERIALS: Made from quality materials. 3CR13 black stainless steel fine edge gut hook and caper blades provide an excellent balance of hardness and corrosion resistance.
OUTDOOR EVOLVED: Where the outdoors meets the gentleman’s carry. Combines traditional and non-traditional materials to create handsome and, unique, combinations that redefine the category.

DEPENDABLE: Provides consistent razor-sharp cutting performance and high durability. A knife you can count on for camping, hiking, backpacking, hunting & fishing, the outdoors, military & tactical needs, DIY activities, survival, self-defense, and emergencies.
DIMENSIONS: Gut Hook Knife: 6.5-inches overall, Caper Knife: 7-inches overall.
SPECIAL FEATURES: 2-Piece Fixed Blade Hunting Knife Set- Camo Coated Nylon Fiber Handles, Includes Combo Nylon Sheath.
